body_html:
While running tests, I found that some loops were having side effects on objects in memory. The arrays I was creating were only holding object references, not fresh copies of the object, ex:

const thing1 = [{ a: 1 }, { b: 2 }, { c: 3 }];
const thing2 = [].concat(thing1);
thing2[0].a = 5;
console.log(thing1[0].a); // 5

Once I copied the array(s) by value instead of by reference, the tests ran successfully. I'm not sure if this is an inherent design issue with my reducer/actions, or if it's just one of those React gotchas (that people usually solve with Immutable.js).
